data.title: The 90+ Best Movies That Start With C, Ranked
data.meta_description: Over 100 filmgoers have voted on the 90+ Best Movies That Start With C, Ranked. Current Top 3: Close Encounters of the Third Kind, Cool Hand Luke, Casablanca ...
data.text:
Ranked By

2.2K votes

103 voters

2 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote on your favorite movies that with the letter C.

Latest additions: Challengers, Cash Out, City Hunter

Most divisive: Casino

Over 100 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 90+ Best Movies That Start With C, Ranked

Curating a collection of the best movies that start with the letter C has been quite the cinematic adventure. This list is a celebration of films that pack a punch, like Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon with its breathtaking martial arts and mystical storytelling that transcends language and culture. At the same time, we tip our hats to classics like Casablanca, widely considered one of the best movies of all time.

This list of movies that start with the letter ‘C’ has been curated by movie experts with an eye for great filmmaking and supported by votes from fans who love a good flick. These C-titled films are not just starting with the same letter; they strike chords with audiences for their captivating stories, characters, and the lingering impact they've had over the years. So, get comfortable, and let's check out this compelling list of cinematic treasures that truly represent the best of the 'C's. Vote on your favorite movie that starts with the letter C below and help us determine which one reigns above all the rest.

Actors : Richard Dreyfuss, François Truffaut, Teri Garr, Melinda Dillon, Cary Guffey

Released : 1977

Close Encounters of the Third Kind, an awe-inspiring exploration of humanity's first contact with extraterrestrial life, showcases Steven Spielberg's boundless imagination and directorial genius. The iconic star-studded cast and hauntingly beautiful narrative has left an indelible mark on the sci-fi genre, capturing the hearts and minds of audiences for generations.

Actors : Paul Newman, George Kennedy, J.D. Cannon, Lou Antonio, Robert Drivas

Released : 1967

Cool Hand Luke, graced by the enigmatic presence of Paul Newman, tells the riveting tale of a rebellious anti-hero trapped in an oppressive prison system. With his magnetic charm and unyielding spirit, Luke becomes a symbol of hope and inspiration for his fellow inmates, as this powerhouse of a film delivers a sharp social commentary on the human condition.

Actors : Humphrey Bogart, Ingrid Bergman, Paul Henreid, Claude Rains, Conrad Veidt

Released : 1942

Casablanca, an all-time classic, has enamored audiences for generations with its poignant portrayal of star-crossed lovers Rick and Ilsa, played to perfection by the iconic duo of Humphrey Bogart and Ingrid Bergman. Set against the background of war-torn North Africa, this masterpiece of cinematic artistry boasts masterful storytelling, unforgettable characters, and unparalleled emotional depth.

Clyde Geronimi, Wilfred Jackson, Hamilton Luske

Actors : Ilene Woods, Eleanor Audley, Verna Felton, Claire Du Brey, Rhoda Williams

Released : 1950

Cinderella, the quintessential fairy tale brought beautifully to life by Disney's deft hand, has delighted audiences for generations with its enchanting story of love conquering all odds. With memorable songs and spellbinding animation, the film has arguably set the gold standard for animated classics, capturing the essence of magic and wonderment that defines the Disney experience.

Actors : Chow Yun-Fat, Michelle Yeoh, Zhang Ziyi, Chen Chang, Liang Hsiung

Released : 2000

Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon is a dazzling feat of groundbreaking martial arts and enthralling storytelling. Directed by the visionary Ang Lee, the film weaves an intricate tapestry of love, revenge, and destiny, with a mesmerizing ensemble of memorable characters, including Chow Yun-Fat's stoic swordsman and Zhang Ziyi's fierce warrior.

Actors : Leonardo DiCaprio, Tom Hanks, Christopher Walken, Martin Sheen, Nathalie Baye

Released : 2002

Catch Me If You Can, a thrilling cat-and-mouse caper, exhilarates with its remarkable true-life story of a con man pursued by a tenacious FBI agent. Leonardo DiCaprio and Tom Hanks shine as the eponymous characters, with the film's slick direction, energetic pacing, and captivating plot making for a sizzling cinematic treat.
